title: tokens not showing in my balance

labels.name: stale
labels.description: PRs or Issue that are inactive

body:
Im new to MEW, I just had some tokens transfer to my address. According to etherscan the transaction was completed successfully. I add the tokens manually because they didn't appear on the list. The tokens show on the right side under the symbol i entered, but according to the app my account holds 0 tokens.

can someone assist me I have been reading posts for hours now and cant seem t figure it out

Thanks

Make sure you have the contract address and decimal count of the tokens you've added correct. 

Head to Etherscan.io and search your address. Go under 'Token' balances and click the token you are trying to see on MEW.

To the right, you should see 'Contract address' and 'Decimal'. These are the values that you want to add into the 'Add Custom Token' option, along with the symbol (abbreviation) of the currency. 

If you post your address, or the token you are trying to see, I can provide this information for a sort of confirmation that you're entering it correctly.

Hello,

Thank you for replying.

The token is Paycent (PYN) token address
0x0142C3B2fC51819B5aF5dFc4AA52Df9722790851
decimal: 18

I have added it 3 times to myetherwallet. It appears on the right side with
my token amount but within a few hours it disappears and I have to enter it
again.

But on myetherwallet app, never shows the token, just says this address
currently doesn't own any tokens?

Thanks


ᐧ

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/10665890/57576602-8e3b9600-7431-11e9-976f-d6331445d317.png)
   
Same here! I don't have the tokens panel entirely!
I downloaded the zip file from Github releases, and neither of the v5.0.11 variants show the tokens panel.
I simply unzipped the zip file, then clicked on index.html

The balance shows up however, when I use etherscan.io
This issue has been automatically marked as stale because it has not had recent activity. It will be closed within 10 days if no further activity occurs. Thank you for your contributions.
